document.title: Fine Arts Standards of Learning Music Elementary and Middle School Instrumental

C480A12F28DD43CA84234F5564C7D8F1.description:
Use articulations, dynamic contrasts, and
phrasing as means of expression.

and perform tempo changes in the music
literature being studied.

gestures.

intonation.

intonation.

Use articulations, dynamic contrasts, and

D004999C065146CABB9F65E9AEAFD7EA.description:
Maintain a steady beat at various tempos in

FDEB5FCB1BC24E3D892C2B3BC52699F1.description:
Respond to conducting patterns and
gestures.

4E941CE8A0B8442281037C590699F31C.description: Match dynamic levels and playing style.

1E0DA59DDB4A4D139E26CC8BF81CEE0D.description:
Make adjustments to facilitate correct
intonation.

ED44ABEE63374A8693FDAF0A33F08579.description:
Identify the characteristic sound of the
instrument being studied.

E87E5C1946C74CA0B315EA2C618E6F4D.description:
The student will demonstrate musicianship and
ensemble skills at a beginning level.

200553D8F44B4CC08A8CF141990FF256.description:
Guitar student—right-hand techniques
(finger style and pick style) and left-hand
techniques (vibrato, slurs, string-bending,
and barre techniques).

5C45B975609C4A5C9B3519ED282A4F20.description:
Percussion student—stick control,
appropriate grip, and continued
performance of roll, diddle, flam, and drag
rudiments with increasing difficulty; tuning
timpani while playing; playing techniques
on mallet and auxiliary instruments.

AAE1A1D3F84640C6992150A559607D28.description:
Orchestral string student—proper bow
placement, weight, angle, speed, and
pressure; various articulations (brush stroke,
tremolo); a beginning vibrato motion;
shifting to higher positions as needed.

DA6A6F8723BE4F21BD19CC6C361F9663.description:
Wind student—proper breathing
techniques and embouchure; various
articulations (tenuto, sforzando).

406A55C19B2F4FA78977057296BE1DB0.description:
Produce tones that are clear, free of tension,
sustained, and centered in pitch.

61B31ABB87FA4666AEB7D4F57F7330A8.description:
Consistently adjust and control intonation
while playing.

DE84D5DD319F46CC873A0AFF6E3BB243.description:
The student will demonstrate proper
instrumental techniques.

8FA2D153C76049AEB41FC4CB40043922.description:
Guitar student—right-hand techniques
(finger style and pick style), and left-hand-techniques (vibrato, slurs, string-bending
and barre techniques).

D6AE5BB35C54438ABA4C1CD7B70A6951.description:
Percussion student—stick control,
appropriate grip, and continued
performance of roll, diddle, flam, and drag
rudiments with increasing difficulty; playing
techniques on mallet and auxiliary
instruments.

AF665FC07F7448B09414677C8851A760.description:
Orchestral string student—proper bow
placement, weight, angle, speed, and
pressure; contrasting articulations (détaché,
accents, hooked bowing, multiple-note
slurs, slurred staccato, sforzando).

70670195FA914615A00E31311F526454.description:
Wind student—proper breathing
techniques and embouchure; contrasting
articulations (legato, marcato).

FF9A691351704486B020EA2F27F0592E.description:
Produce tones that are clear, free of tension,
sustained, and unwavering in pitch.

33DE2CFE38044987B1895CD058B3723E.description:
The student will demonstrate proper
instrumental techniques.

BAC9F3FE278F49F786A8B5799ED74626.description:
Guitar student—correct left hand position
and finger placement, right hand position
and techniques (finger style and pick style).

418E939F9E2843D0BA3445DC945989AC.description:
Percussion student—stick control,
appropriate grip, and performance of
beginning roll, diddle, flam and drag
rudiments; and multiple bounce roll; playing
techniques on mallet and auxiliary
instruments.

E41D4F7BC70A49FF9A17BA9312D10466.description:
Orchestral string student—proper bow
placement, weight, angle, and speed;
contrasting articulations (pizzicato, legato,
staccato, two-note slurs).

654DDE839BB74286A00AD785F540C980.description:
Wind student—proper breathing
techniques and embouchure; contrasting
articulations (tonguing, slurring, staccato,
accent).

EF5C2FA1FA5C44B9A9160EB51646108A.description:
Produce tones that are clear, free of tension,
and sustained.

99A28D5355DA4C0785B7CC239CB8D061.description:
Match pitches and begin to make
adjustments to facilitate correct intonation.

27A9E02412484F39A7BED5B7D7CD2CD7.description:
Identify correct hand positions, finger/slide
placement, fingerings/positions, and
finger/slide patterns.

A3CEFE3CFEFD46209943103A66B2A070.description:
The student will demonstrate proper
instrumental techniques.

CE331BD5FC7F4431B02057819ECAFA94.description:
Basic tuning of the instrument, with and
without an external source.

DBC87F5BD4BB4011A2CAEEA38528EC93.description:
Consistent use of proper playing posture,
instrument position, and hand positions.

CB4E86EE5E3E4F70AC7BECBE9904819D.description:
Procedures for care and maintenance of the
instrument.

09DA5DA3CCCB47DDA77A3C26057DBD9C.description:
The student will independently demonstrate
preparatory playing procedures.

4E15F970C1974AA5B8389CFDCFE91339.description:
Basic tuning of the instrument, with and
without an electronic tuner.

002DC18605134424AB0E424B1219D391.description:
Consistent use of proper playing posture,
instrument position, and hand positions.

511E72D97DED4C5BA09AAC014AE743D0.description:
Care and basic maintenance of the
instrument.

12CB5733F78140218C0FD35A256CD715.description:
The student will identify, describe, and
demonstrate preparatory playing procedures.

739A83A1E7524481A093D2C722A31CC6.description:
Understand procedures for basic tuning of
the instrument with a visual aid or electronic
tuner.

7C1ADCFA03AF4D18972374025639366A.description:
Identify proper playing posture and
instrument position.

3A3F3BFE37E84A119CC4FF2E36C98114.description:
Identify procedures for care of the
instrument.

177F44765C044EC49C1E8E5070178A19.description:
Identify and select an appropriate
instrument.

55E035D724FB40C3B0822377746B492B.description:
The student will demonstrate preparatory
instrumental basics and playing procedures.

4D25E16709E14AD2AA944D9B51F89BCA.description:
Guitar student— ascending and descending
scales; major, natural minor, and harmonic
minor scales of at least two octaves up to
five sharps/three flats; chromatic scales up
to the 12th fret; two forms of the movable
blues scales. First position, barre chords, and
movable jazz chords. A ii7-V7-I7 chord
progression in a variety of keys. A 12-bar
blues progression in a variety of keys.

23916EEE3A2248D1B153325AAC822C6C.description:
Orchestral string student—one-octave F
and B-flat major scales; two-octave C, G,
and D, and major scales a, e, b, d, and g
minor scales.

18CF28EBA2DF4CE081F896D38A83FB24.description:
Wind/ percussion student— concert C, F, Bflat, E-flat, A-flat, D-flat, G, and D major
scales; g, d, and c minor scales; an extended
chromatic scale.

B7F659DF11E347F1A7873CF3310B2B2A.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate half-step and whole-step patterns in order to read,
notate, understand, and perform scales, key
signatures, and/or chords.

C4DEE9AC8D524CD298B7FC95C0F2542D.description:
Guitar student—scales and chords in root
position and in inversions. One-octave
major, natural minor, and harmonic minor
scales up to four sharps/two flats. Chromatic
scales up to the 12th fret. One form of the
movable, two-octave blues scale. First
position and barre chords using eight basic
forms: E, E7, Em, Em7, A, A7, Am, Am7.
Power chords with roots on the sixth and
fifth strings through 10th position. A I-IV-V7
chord progression in the keys of C, G, D, A,
E and F major and A and E minor. A 12-bar
blues progression in the keys of A and E.

8D35E758B84E4DD5878AE61F062482C5.description:
Orchestral string student—one-octave C, G,
D, F, and B-flat major scales and a, e, g, and
d minor scales (double bass dropping to
lower string as needed).

4C6B1FB3C47443A4844AEFD53A1E5179.description:
Wind/percussion student— concert C, F, Bflat, E-flat, A-flat, and G major scales; g and
d minor scales; chromatic scale.

BAA4830C601A41CD882E6E1FD3262B9C.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate half-step and whole-step patterns in order to read,
notate, understand and perform scales, key
signatures, and/or chords.

FF8E40FC7F30475C828A700425747197.description:
Guitar student—one-octave ascending and
descending major, natural and harmonic
scales up to three sharps/one flat; a
chromatic scale; one form of the moveable,
one-octave pentatonic scale; open position
chords; power chords with roots on the
sixth and fifth strings; a I-IV-V7 chord
progression in the keys of C, G, D, and A
major, and A and E minor; and 12-bar blues
in a variety of keys.

ED155136F7594ABBA66FF91FA03C622C.description:
Orchestral string student—one-octave G, D,
and C major scales and introduce the
concept of minor scales.

C783E80EE7DF4A09863E74AE6C4662A8.description:
Wind/percussion student—one-octave
concert F, B-flat, and E-flat major scales and
chromatic patterns.

013D696273D54BCABC22CDD1AD41ED79.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate half-step and whole-step patterns in order to read,
notate, understand and perform scales, key
signatures, and/or chords.

1E4F15B46AD547C3B31084D2D7169079.description:
Guitar student— read and create chord
diagrams; read basic rhythm guitar using first
position chords; read and correctly interpret
guitar tablature.

FEBF0709EBF442BD822DF587BAEEAE72.description:
Sight-read music of varying styles and levels
of difficulty.

1B98838590F942219497E8C488E61AB2.description:
Read and interpret standard music notation
while performing music of varying styles and
levels of difficulty.

8DA82D48951E4466B7B43790AEC8E67B.description:
Define and consistently apply music
terminology found in the music literature
being studied.

C55D22B78B3B4DA1810D62FE7063514E.description:
Identify and perform music written in
theme-and-variations form.

7FDCE765171F4A1FB80E8F7B68933E83.description:
Identify, read, and perform music in
complex meters, including compound and
asymmetrical meters.

16CD80EF8EA946BAA12147457F0B58F8.description:
Read, count (using a counting system),
perform, and compose rhythms and
rhythmic patterns that include quarter-note
triplets and corresponding rests.

02A50899900D4A3B98BAA259628DAD32.description:
Sing assigned parts in combination with
other parts from the music being studied.

FDEC53DE12304287881C5751DBDD438C.description:
Notate student-created compositions using
standard notation.

A58B4CCE061747C6996FEC725D5CAF30.description:
Identify, define, and use advanced standard
and instrument specific notation for pitch,
rhythm, meter, articulation, dynamics, and
other elements of music.

BFC473C0C4534FDC8CB4AA3DE1A89FC8.description: The student will demonstrate music literacy.

15BA3FD3168047488ADAEA728EF45BE7.description:
Guitar student—identify and perform music
written in ABA and strophic forms.

0572F14E432440ACA1A36EA4034925CA.description:
Sight-read music of varying styles and levels
of difficulty.

A2AFDFF866C4482993EE9A86CB8CD466.description:
Define and apply music terminology found
in the music literature being studied.

435D86CAACE94E159C14E45C75F5F389.description:
Identify and perform music written in rondo
and ternary forms.

96E769E72EB04C299338FF780DA0E048.description:
Identify, read, and perform music in 2
2 (alla
breve or cut time) and 6
8 meters.

1AB608822E7C4560A8A2D4E6D3A4F7B9.description:
Echo, read, count (using a counting system),
and perform rhythms and rhythmic patterns,
including sixteenth notes, eighth-note
triplets, dotted eighth notes, corresponding
rests, and syncopations.

A65D3FA776FE46A697A1EA4FE64D17B7.description:
Sing independent parts selected from the
music being studied.

8C4EC477E2AF4C90944B04426006D9C3.description:
Notate student-created compositions using
standard notation.

C18488E24DEF452D9C3CF4FE5A3BA99C.description: The student will demonstrate music literacy.

0877415CADE94A87A395AC1A6347E709.description:
Guitar student— read and create chord
diagrams; read and perform basic rhythm
guitar using G, G7, B7, C, D, D7, Dm, A, A7,
Am, E, E7, Em, and F chords in first position.

86ABB9EC9CDD425D96C73511DC892737.description:
Sight-read music of varying styles and levels
of difficulty.

8AB16088F3EF4A29BCF4169EE9EE9CCB.description:
Read and interpret standard music notation
while performing music of varying styles and
levels of difficulty.

702D56C5A80C483A90BBE32609149AA0.description:
Define and apply music terminology found
in the music literature being studied.

C5CB86868E4F452191A7F6D1CC47CA7E.description:
Identify, read, and perform music in simple
meters ( 2
4 ,
3
4 ,
4
4 , C ).

F857B6E09CC6439B9D0B81940165FECA.description:
Echo, read, count (using a counting system),
and perform simple rhythms and rhythmic
patterns, including whole notes, half notes,
quarter notes, eighth notes, dotted half
notes, dotted quarter notes, and
corresponding rests.

99FAC7AA086C471D9555180C85502F81.description:
Sing selected lines from music being
studied.

309A7E28B7B24A8EAE104CC9713C9BA6.description:
Notate student-created compositions using
standard notation.

36ED9ECA52BC46A69AAB53AAAB618A17.description:
Identify, define, and use basic standard and
instrument specific notation for pitch,
rhythm, meter, articulation, dynamics, and
other elements of music.

B077887D94AB4715869297795E47A2E4.description: The student will demonstrate music literacy.

51818D42951049E9916A14D14E01CA2D.description:
Music Literacy: Acquire the technical
skills and artistic
knowledge necessary
for creative, expressive,
and artistic
performance.
Demonstrate
understanding of
elements of music and
ways they are used for
artistic performance and
creative expression

6D416BBF107E49D3991C560C4BC96588.description:
The student will analyze cross-disciplinary
connections with music.

FC862D194DE74DBF87FD15B4F65B6F17.description:
The student will examine the relationship
of instrumental music to the other fine arts.

CE3ACBAFF06F457A9CDDDED3726573AC.description:
The student will describe the connections
of instrumental music to the other fine arts
and other fields of knowledge.

DC67588AB24846A4B2B4672FD7B48802.description:
Cultivate connections to other fine arts
and fields of knowledge. Identify and cultivate connections
between music and other fields of
knowledge to develop problem-solving
skills.

D0C486D145EB4F1C895E1C8F1B36085D.description:
The student will explore and investigate
technology and new media to create, edit,
and present music.

1667AF9C0834473EAC494FE2B52F9D3C.description:
The student will identify and explore ways
that new media is used to create and edit
music.

B23A8FB8F753434DBD84D5C49135FF4C.description:
The student will identify ways in which
culture and technology influence the
development of music and musical styles,
including the ways sound is manipulated.

DBE66E7990B94DCF857354DB6BD249DA.description:
Understand and explore the impact of
current and emerging technologies. Participate in a rapidly changing world of
music and explore the impact of current
and emerging technologies, media, and
processes.

F22121B31AE04627B4059897E781842F.description:
The student will investigate connections
between music skills and college, career,
and workplace skills.

CFA6F830624A4AFE9E2256490AA41CC8.description:
The student will compare and contrast
career options in music in relation to career
preparation.

F63473EA3D004DEC8C9F1AFF639E562D.description:
The student will describe career options in
music.

DC61C75AB7BC46EEA02602460ADF99B9.description:
College, career, and the 21st Century
Workplace. Connect music content and skills to career
options, college opportunities, and the 21st
Century workplace.

1F71D140190647B6A898D4F8DD1D6E07.description:
The student will explain and apply digital
citizenship skills related to intellectual
property in music research, performance, and
sharing.

DCB35F5C98EC4298977978C881CD54F2.description:
The student will identify and apply digital
citizenship skills related to intellectual
property in music research, performance, and
sharing.

B71604F6799D42F7A7E3861632B9474F.description:
The student will examine and apply digital
citizenship skills related to intellectual
property as it relates to music.

36B1FD08112D4363B1AFB4929693C6A5.description:
Ethical and legal
considerations for music and
intellectual property. Identify and understand ethical
and legal considerations for
engaging with music,
resources, and source material
as a responsible citizen.

065BEF1A04E343E2921D0CA487CCDDEF.description:
The student will describe opportunities for
music performance and advocacy within the
community.

5837867F0D254247AB21B1DCBB2E5353.description:
The student will describe how musicians,
consumers of music, and music advocates
impact the community.

43F27E609DD44E629D330E07B8B3C3F4.description:
The student will explore the functions of
music, including the use of music as a form of
expression, communication, ceremony, and
entertainment.

6C1745FC6E7A449BA7F82711D239E0FA.description:
Understand music as a form of
community engagement. Identify and interact with music
and develop a lifelong
engagement as a performer,
supporter, advocate, and
audience member.

F01069B8E81B43FBB1FA94633E6240A0.description:
Analyze the characteristics of instrumental
music from a variety of cultures.

FEDF30115776420F8CCCEECE99D08FE6.description:
Compare and contrast a variety of musical
periods and styles using music
terminology.

9C5FE2E36AC04B129C760F383B6D6C79.description:
Analyze the cultural influences, musical
styles, composers, and historical periods
associated with the music literature
through listening, performing, and
studying.

5D9371C1A7164D18BC0202D4347D6380.description:
The student will explore historical and cultural
influences of music.

5D5FD0DE28924ADF9A7AE1FAC6A7A884.description:
Compare and contrast the functions of
instrumental music in a variety of cultures.

9B5532958F7B4C34820D420EDADB9BE5.description:
Compare and contrast a variety of musical
styles using music terminology.

3D5527E90DDB45BA91B4027D66DAFCB7.description:
Describe the cultural influences, musical
styles, composers, and historical periods
associated with the music literature
through listening, performing, and
studying.

BBB04D31827D4E93BA1282E7AFF7B36A.description:
The student will explore historical and cultural
influences of music.

3A68C31C704A43C7B6138AE80A5A0795.description:
Describe ways in which culture influences
the development of instruments,
instrumental music, and instrumental
music styles.

4F16144001C446B68E4C045757DD3614.description:
Identify the cultural influences, musical
styles, composers, and historical periods
associated with the music literature
through listening, performing, and
studying.

8594AB10A17642ABBC337E70FE0837F0.description:
The student will explore historical and cultural
influences of music.

C333B3DC53B64FDE8E5F842E9E76EA4E.description:
Understand cultural and
historical influences of music. Demonstrate understanding of
cultural and historical
influences of music.

3287356D3A6A4D12BFF6B29A12A935F6.description:
Consistently demonstrate exemplary
concert etiquette as an active listener.

549503BD10E0477F9C59710FF4A4F6B7.description:
Apply rehearsal and concert etiquette as a
performer (e.g., using critical aural skills,
following conducting gestures,
maintaining attention in rest position).

62C8DEA833364FFCBE01285C3B48993E.description:
Participate in curricular and co-curricular
performances, and in local, district, or
regional events as appropriate to level,
ability, and interest.

85F3119635AF4819A72CDD3621FA772B.description:
The student will explain and apply
collaboration and communication skills for
music.

E1F66EDA615743B38D2F91DB52AFC788.description:
Demonstrate concert etiquette as an
active listener.

708E3BED8BF84043BFE0EDB1C5387391.description:
Describe and demonstrate rehearsal and
concert etiquette as a performer (e.g.,
using critical aural skills, following
conducting gestures, maintaining
attention in rest position).

72207D79737044A48BB91053E05C5B13.description:
Participate in curricular and co-curricular
school performances, and in local, district,
or regional events as appropriate to level,
ability, and interest.

F96A1392560F480EB3DA700A08C0306A.description:
The student will describe and demonstrate
collaboration and communication skills for
music.

2F6FD92411FE4AEEBF007534C525C248.description:
Describe and demonstrate active listening
in rehearsal and as an audience member.

07B10D4A15A544D599F10F6D391671F3.description:
Describe and demonstrate rehearsal and
concert etiquette as a performer (e.g.,
using critical aural skills, following
conducting gestures, maintaining
attention in rest position).

223006CF0BC141FBA79521BC92ACE002.description:
Participate in school performances, and in
local, district, or regional events as
appropriate to level, ability, and interest.

3FE60B8694774CF391F1A65790E38EAD.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate
collaboration and communication skills for
music.

E1CF6FB55D2443AF9DA8C3D8776A937A.description:
Develop collaboration and
communication skills for
music rehearsal and
performance. Identify and apply
collaboration and
communication skills for
rehearsal and performance of
music.

026A941768F8450F873C4ECFECEE6F57.description:
Apply criteria for determining the quality
of a work of music or importance of a
musical style.

1B1F4C1CE07141FE9B929779F3A58873.description:
Identify personal criteria used for
evaluating works of music.

FA8590F73AAF42D09D0C3A12E33F070B.description:
Analyze personal responses to works of
music using music terminology.

81B8B90936D64656AB1B4214B056A81B.description:
The student will formulate and justify personal
responses to music.

494E5A2E5AF047F1A28DCA19810BC957.description:
Apply aesthetic criteria for determining
the quality of a work of music or
importance of a musical style.

D348B47ECBD0403F8C43E9EDA178F0AD.description:
Analyze ways in which music can evoke
emotion and be persuasive.

7B3B283B9F664C309A1BF1AEDC1AFB2D.description:
Describe personal responses to works of
music using music terminology.

9AAE6125ADAC46E5BB6951E763F4F72D.description:
Explain how the factors of time and place
influence the characteristics that give
meaning and value to a work of music.

189B4478825E41E285ED99B265A1F434.description:
The student will formulate and justify personal
responses to music.

C4A6FECFE985452F8CFF76952084E381.description:
Describe aesthetic criteria used for
determining the quality of a work of music
or importance of a musical style.

1AC8E2ECF8E045D68A415D0949B39025.description:
Identify ways in which music evokes
sensory, emotional, and intellectual
responses, including ways in which music
can be persuasive.

D893D166708D46E18E23C727C96FF12B.description:
Identify reasons for preferences among
works of music using music terminology.

D6403C41ED594C4D981303E0EDF77993.description:
The student will formulate and justify personal
responses to music.

A50E9D1A458840ED8BE011ACA8FA9D0A.description:
Formulate and justify
personal responses and
connections to music. Recognize, justify, and
articulate personal responses,
beliefs, and opinions regarding
music and recognize the value
in learning about diverse
opinions and responses to
music.

D0BF87D12F6D46FB820823FB5A6331A2.description:
Apply accepted criteria for analyzing,
evaluating, and critiquing works of music.

992F27085ED64137A4E7EF924F04ACD7.description:
Examine ways in which personal
experiences influence critical judgment
about works of music and musical
performances.

7193A063B0D74330AA882816B27B90FB.description:
Compare and contrast the style, cultural
influences, and historical contexts of music
literature being studied.

DCCB58E429C5466B84B750EDEA2380C1.description:
The student will analyze, interpret, and
evaluate music.

95542A223CAD4581932883689E9C02E7.description:
Describe performances of music using
music terminology.

A0DEBB0D663548F2AC11FD9496E35169.description:
Apply accepted criteria for analyzing,
critiquing, and evaluating works of music.

60BE68F8EB064CA4ADAAC5DE7B619841.description:
Interpret diverse works of music using
inquiry skills and music terminology.

C35D6C2B7CBC4DDF8A0A08C1DD8C11E0.description:
The student will analyze, interpret, and
evaluate music.

61D140BD0DBA49CEB9A5A18310BFF91B.description:
Describe performances of music using
music terminology.

F014C48C7F6A4200BFBCDDA7BF4EF75D.description:
Describe accepted criteria used for
evaluating works of music.

04CE823D981A485D89F54DF5C5A18F6B.description:
Describe and interpret diverse works of
music using inquiry skills and music
terminology.

8E4B9A57BB2C443488F3696C54337121.description:
The student will analyze, interpret, and
evaluate music.

4D2B58C947D14D5FB0A2255408F00494.description:
Analyze, interpret, and
evaluate music. Develop critical thinking skills
in the analysis, interpretation,
and evaluation of the work of
self and others.

4D96B578910E4DA8B1AA34CFB260D0AC.description:
Monitor individual practice and
progress toward goals.

EBAE57FA321743CEA5A6F8C8BE3D8875.description:
Develop individual solutions to creative
challenges through independent
research, investigation, and inquiry of
music idea and concepts.

B90BCE302F014B8E98DF5FB2B6F961B8.description:
Apply steps of a creative process in a
variety of contexts in music.

14D23B34E2E54F16BF68D00D99C035F9.description:
The student will apply a creative process for
music.

CEE5DDD18AD34BB0AD53EF5112BB3D86.description:
Monitor individual practice and
progress toward goals.

4131415BFEBA4E849C303C802CD711BE.description:
Collaboratively identify and examine
inquiry-based questions related to
music.

Apply steps of a creative process in a

music.

9EEE63DAA86A4F1DAFA24CE2B2875285.description:
Monitor individual practice and
progress toward goals.

Collaboratively identify and examine
inquiry-based questions related to
music.

8D0DC8D19616453F8BAB0C73A5808A94.description:
Identify and apply steps of a creative
process in a variety of contexts in music.

A5743DF27C52421AB3DBDA580BC97AA8.description:
The student will apply a creative process for
music.

FB3C6425818C4819B89A74DBB3D1E515.description:
Understand and apply a creative process
to develop ideas for creating and
performing music.
Understand and apply a creative process to
guide the development of ideas and
original work.

3CD3FE37E16E443799A694E5DBD06ABB.description:
Write and perform rhythmic-melodic
variations of selections taken from
existing melodies, exercises, or etudes,
incorporating a variety of expressive
elements.

F5B90EE5A35843B3A78B718971E214FD.description:
Improvise increasingly complex
rhythmic and melodic examples in call-and-response styles.

9171BD0BCDBB4F7EAEF41D17577043BD.description:
The student will create music as a means of
expression.

8211877194384CB39D89325658B2CC84.description:
Write and perform melodic variations
of four- to-eight-measure selections
taken from existing melodies, exercises,
or etudes.

AD2CADB413294EE78E5B54ACC75B4E5C.description:
Improvise simple rhythmic and melodic
examples in call-and-response styles.

CC85FC4A441E431F9AEF8C8F12AFF0CC.description:
The student will create music as a means of
individual expression.

DC750737509D4D1B8D6FA5730DDAD6E0.description:
Play and write rhythmic variations of
four-measure selections taken from
existing melodies, exercises, or etudes.

75AC6799E0C445118D424911AAFCDD19.description:
Improvise simple rhythmic and melodic
examples in call-and-response styles.

BEF8AB8C43F3456D92DCB5A613F22D11.description:
The student will create music as a means of
individual expression.

E3BA9906FACF4C6A9742877AF5AC2131.description:
Apply creative thinking to composing and
improvising music. Apply creative thinking by employing
originality, flexibility, experimentation,
individual voice, and imagination to
improvise and compose music.
